required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring Cyclotorsion on Scanning Laser Ophthalmoscopy (SLO)-Fundus Photographs
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring Cyclotorsion on Scanning Laser Ophthalmoscopy (SLO)-Fundus Photographs Using the Integrated Algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis

brief_summary.textblock:
Pre-Study: Evaluation of the inter- and intrarater reliability of the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis for measuring cyclotorsion on SLO-fundus fotographs, and assessment of the influence of measuring with or without eye tracker.
Study: Comparison of cyclotorsion measurements in patients with forth nerve palsy and in healthy controls on SLO-fundus fotographs using the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis

primary_outcome.measure: pre-study: reliability of repeated measurements of excyclotorsion in degrees on SLO-fundus fotographs
primary_outcome.description: pre-study: inter- and intrarater reliability of the device with or without eye tracker; excyclotorsion in degrees (based on the line crossing the fovea and the center of the optic nerve head) as provided by the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis

primary_outcome.measure: study: excyclotorsion in degrees on SLO-fundus fotographs
primary_outcome.description: study: comparison of cyclotorsion measurements in healthy controls compared to patients with forth nerve palsy; excyclotorsion in degrees (based on the line crossing the fovea and the center of the optic nerve head) as provided by the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis

secondary_outcome.measure: study: excyclotorsion in degrees on tangent screen, double maddox and fundus photographs
secondary_outcome.description: validation of the cyclotorsion measurement with the Heidelberg Spectralis device against tangent screen [degrees], double maddox [degrees] and fundus photographs [degrees]

arm_group.description: pre-study: inter- and intrarater reliability study in 30 healthy subjects, interventions: SLO-fundus photographs using the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis OCT (optical coherence tomography) device

measurement of cyclotorsion on SLO-fundusphoto in 20 patients forth nerve palsy interventions: SLO-fundus photographs using the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis OCT (optical coherence tomography) device

measurement of cyclotorsion on SLO-fundusphoto in 30 healthy subjects to be compared to patients with forth nerve palsy interventions: SLO-fundus photographs using the integrated algorithm by Heidelberg Spectralis OCT (optical coherence tomography) device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 18 years old
- best corrected visual acuity ≥ 0.8
Exclusion Criteria:
- strabismus except for forth nerve palsy
- previous strabismus surgery
- monocle
- best corrected visual acuity ≤ 0.6
- hyperopia or myopia > 6dpt

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Zurich, Dept of Ophthalmology

facility.name: University Hospital Zurich, Dept of Ophthalmology
